New Records: Luka Modric became the oldest scorer in European Championship history with a goal at 38 years, 289 days.
Key Match Events: Luka Modric scored a penalty to give Croatia a 55th-minute lead.
Mattia Zaccagni scored a 98th-minute equalizer to secure a 1-1 draw.
Gianluca Scamacca was inches from connecting with a cross in the 87th minute.
Post-Match Reflections: Luka Modric praised the team's resilience after coming back from 2-0 down.
Mattia Zaccagni expressed immense satisfaction and excitement after scoring the late equalizer.
Coach Luciano Spalletti acknowledged the team's performance and expressed optimism for the next match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dominik Livakovic made crucial saves to keep the game close.
The game was played at Red Bull Arena in Leipzig, Germany.
